content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
No composite production structure has been successfully established. The agent made repeated attempts to produce and place a Lab at position (0.5, 2.5) for supplying Automation Science Packs to support research. However, due to inventory shortages and subsequent crafting issues the Lab was never created. Although existing furnaces were utilized for smelting—one at position (5.0, 5.0) for iron plate production and another at position (–27.0, –60.0) for copper plate production—these actions served only for resource processing and did not constitute a constructed structure.

ERROR TIPS
• API Misuse for Entity Retrieval
 – Avoid using unsupported keyword arguments (e.g., “radius”) and adhere to the function’s signature to prevent errors such as “unexpected keyword argument” or “takes 0 positional arguments but 3 were given.”

• Lab Placement Failures
 – Confirm that the Lab item is present in the inventory before attempting placement.
 – Verify that placement conditions are met so that a Lab can be successfully positioned on the map.

• Lab Crafting Failures
 – Ensure all sub-ingredients (e.g., iron-gear-wheel, electronic-circuit, copper-cable) are available before crafting; missing or insufficient resources lead to crafting errors.
 – Validate that collections used for filtering (such as the list of existing Labs) are not None to avoid iteration errors.

• Resource Management
 – Regularly monitor and update resource counts (from smelting operations or harvesting) to meet the production requirements of complex items like the Lab.
